name: Missi Roti
history: Missi Roti is a traditional North Indian flatbread made from a blend of flours. It originated in the Punjab region and is known for its nutritious value and unique flavor, which comes from the use of various spices and gram flour.
description: Missi Roti is made from a mix of whole wheat and gram (chickpea) flour, seasoned with spices like turmeric, red chili powder, and ajwain (carom seeds). This flatbread is cooked on a griddle and often served with butter, curd, or pickles.

instructions.title: Prepare the Dough
instructions.description: In a bowl, mix whole wheat flour, gram flour, ajwain, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Gradually add water and knead into a soft dough. Let it rest for 15 minutes.

instructions.title: Roll and Cook the Rotis
instructions.description: Divide the dough into small balls. Mix in chopped cilantro and onion if desired. Roll each ball into a thin circle. Cook on a hot griddle, flipping and applying ghee or oil until both sides have golden brown spots.

instructions.title: Serve
instructions.description: Serve the hot missi rotis with butter, curd, or pickles.

tips: The dough should be well-kneaded for soft rotis.
Adding onion to the dough gives an extra flavor but is optional.
variations: Experiment with other spices like cumin or coriander powder for different flavors.
Try different fillings like spiced potatoes or paneer for a stuffed version.

storage.shelfLife: Best consumed fresh but can be stored in an airtight container for up to 24 hours.
storage.instructions: Reheat on a griddle before serving if stored.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat on a hot griddle or tawa until warm and soft.
presentationTips: Serve in a basket lined with a cloth to keep them warm.
Pair with a variety of chutneys and side dishes for a complete meal.
